questions.question: What is vocal resonance?
choices: The vibration of the vocal folds
The amplification and enrichment of vocal tone by air-filled cavities
The process of breathing while singing
The tension in the larynx during phonation
questions.answer: The amplification and enrichment of vocal tone by air-filled cavities

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT considered a primary resonator in the vocal tract?
questions.answer: Lungs

questions.question: What are formants in vocal production?
choices: The shape of the vocal folds
Concentrated areas of acoustic energy that define vowel sounds
The rate of vocal fold vibration
The amount of air pressure used in singing
questions.answer: Concentrated areas of acoustic energy that define vowel sounds

questions.question: Which of the following is an adjustable part of the vocal tract?
questions.answer: Soft palate

questions.question: What is vowel modification in singing?
choices: Changing the lyrics of a song
Adjusting vowel shapes to enhance resonance and tone quality
Speaking vowels instead of singing them
Removing vowels from the text entirely
questions.answer: Adjusting vowel shapes to enhance resonance and tone quality

questions.question: Which formant is related to tongue height?
questions.answer: First formant (F1)

questions.question: What is a common characteristic of traditional Timorese vocal qualities?
choices: Bright, forward placement in many styles
questions.answer: Bright, forward placement in many styles

questions.question: How does raising or lowering the larynx affect resonance?
choices: It has no effect on resonance
It only affects pitch, not resonance
It changes the shape and length of the vocal tract, altering resonance
It only affects volume, not resonance
questions.answer: It changes the shape and length of the vocal tract, altering resonance

questions.question: What is the purpose of using a mirror during resonance exercises?
choices: To observe changes in mouth shape and position
To time the duration of exercises
questions.answer: To observe changes in mouth shape and position

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a technique for manipulating resonance?
questions.answer: Finger placement

questions.question: What is the relationship between vowel modification and high notes in singing?
choices: Vowels should always remain unmodified on high notes
Vowels are typically modified to maintain resonance and ease of production
High notes require no vowel sounds at all
Vowel modification only applies to low notes
questions.answer: Vowels are typically modified to maintain resonance and ease of production

questions.question: Which part of Timor-Leste is associated with more nasal vocal qualities?
questions.answer: Eastern Timor

questions.question: What is the effect of lip rounding on vocal resonance?
choices: It has no effect on resonance
questions.answer: It lowers formant frequencies

questions.question: Which vocal style has influenced some modern Timorese singing, incorporating darker vowels?
questions.answer: Portuguese fado

questions.question: What is the primary function of the second formant (F2) in vowel production?
choices: It relates to vocal fold thickness
It controls the rate of vibrato
questions.answer: It relates to tongue advancement

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of understanding and applying proper resonance techniques?
questions.answer: Enhanced vocal projection without strain

questions.question: What type of exercise is commonly used to help singers feel and develop their resonance?
questions.answer: Humming

questions.question: In the context of Timorese vocal music, what technique is often used in ritual songs?
questions.answer: Open throat technique

questions.question: What is the purpose of using a tuning fork in resonance exercises?
choices: To measure the volume of the voice
To provide a consistent pitch reference
questions.answer: To provide a consistent pitch reference

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a factor influencing an individual's unique vocal timbre?
questions.answer: Color of the singer's eyes

questions.question: What is the primary goal of vowel modification exercises?
choices: To change the meaning of words
To develop flexibility in adjusting resonance across the vocal range
questions.answer: To develop flexibility in adjusting resonance across the vocal range

questions.question: How does the hard palate contribute to vocal resonance?
choices: It acts as a fixed reflective surface for sound waves
questions.answer: It acts as a fixed reflective surface for sound waves

questions.question: What is the relationship between resonance and vocal health?
choices: Proper resonance can help reduce vocal strain
Resonance has no impact on vocal health
More resonance always leads to vocal damage
Resonance only affects the aesthetic quality of the voice
questions.answer: Proper resonance can help reduce vocal strain

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of Western Timorese vocal style?
questions.answer: Fuller chest resonance

questions.question: What is the purpose of analyzing recordings of traditional Timorese singers?
choices: To understand and reproduce characteristic tonal qualities
questions.answer: To understand and reproduce characteristic tonal qualities

questions.question: How does jaw opening affect vocal resonance?
choices: It has no effect on resonance
It can alter the shape of the oral cavity, influencing resonance
questions.answer: It can alter the shape of the oral cavity, influencing resonance

questions.question: What is the primary difference between classical and contemporary approaches to vowel modification?
choices: Classical singing never uses vowel modification
Contemporary styles always use more extreme modifications
Classical singing typically uses more consistent modification across the range
Contemporary styles prohibit any form of vowel modification
questions.answer: Classical singing typically uses more consistent modification across the range

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common vowel modification for high notes?
questions.answer: [u] to [i]

questions.question: What role do the sinuses play in vocal resonance?
choices: They are the primary source of resonance
They have no role in resonance
questions.answer: They act as secondary resonators

questions.question: How might the unique linguistic features of Tetum influence resonance choices in Timorese vocal music?
choices: They have no influence on resonance
They may require specific vowel shapes and placements
They eliminate the need for resonance
They only affect rhythm, not resonance
questions.answer: They may require specific vowel shapes and placements
